title: Iman Bowie, 64, turns heads in a VERY exaggerated leopard print dress for WWD Honors event in NYC
text:
She is one of the most recognisable supermodels in the world.

And Iman Bowie, 64, showed off her flawless style credentials as she attended the WWD Honors at Intercontinental New York Barclay on Tuesday night.

The Somali-American beauty turned heads in a voluminous exaggerated leopard print dress which featured a sensational train.

Glamorous: Iman Bowie, 64, commanded attention as she attended the WWD Honors at Intercontinental New York Barclay on Tuesday night

Iman ensured that she wore the extravagant gown, and that the gown didn't wear her.

The striking gold foiled dress boasted oversized sleeves while the rest of the ballgown style bottom half flared out over her supermodel figure.

The catwalk queen's youthful features were enhanced with a sultry coat of make-up, while her shoulder length locks were styled in a sleek manner.

Eyes on her: The Somali-American beauty turned heads in a voluminous exaggerated leopard print dress which featured a sensational train - Pictured with Pierepaolo Piccioli

Wow: The striking gold foiled dress boasted oversized sleeves while the rest of the ballgown style bottom half flared out over her supermodel figure

Pretty: The catwalk queen's youthful features were enhanced with a sultry coat of make-up, while her shoulder length locks were styled in a sleek manner.

L-R: Iman, Pierepaolo Piccioli, Nicky Hilton, and Hamish Bowles

Iman, who has been honoured with an array of awards for her charitable efforts over the last few weeks, looked happy and relaxed as she posed away with her company.

On the personal front, earlier this year on April 24, Iman paid tribute to her late husband David on what would have been their 27th wedding anniversary.

Taking to her Instagram page, where she regularly shares inspirational quotes and updates about her life, Iman wrote: 'April 24th Forever Love.#BowieForever.'

Loving life: Iman looked happy and relaxed as she posed away with her company

Charitable: Iman has been honoured with an array of awards for her charitable efforts over the last few weeks

Fun times: Guests gathered around the table for dinner where they also enjoyed light-hearted chats

The couple married on April 24, 1992 in a private ceremony in Lausanne, Switzerland.

Their union was solemnised in Florence, Italy, on June 6 that year. They welcomed their daughter Alexandria, known as Lexi, in 2000.

Legendary musician Bowie died in 2016 aged 69 following a battle with cancer.

After retiring from modelling in 1989, Iman founded Iman Cosmetics, now a $25 million-a-year business, based on makeup for women of colour.

Strike a pose: She smiled for cameras alongside Carlos Souza and Hamish Bowles
